name: Salmon and Asparagus Frittata
instructions: Chop the asparagus and onion into small pieces.
Heat the olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until translucent.
Add the asparagus to the skillet and cook until tender, about 5 minutes.
In a large bowl, whisk the eggs, milk, salt, and black pepper together.
Add the smoked salmon and shredded cheese to the egg mixture and stir to combine.
Pour the egg mixture into the skillet over the asparagus and onion. Stir gently to distribute the ingredients evenly.
Cook on the stove for 3-4 minutes until the edges start to set.
Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 15 minutes or until the frittata is fully set and golden brown on top.
Remove from the oven and let it cool slightly before slicing and serving.
description: A wholesome and protein-rich frittata featuring tender asparagus, savory smoked salmon, and melted cheese. Ideal for a nutritious breakfast or brunch, supporting muscle growth and overall health.
additional_notes: Feel free to substitute smoked salmon with cooked fresh salmon or other favorite smoked fish. It pairs well with a side salad for a complete meal.
